review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2025
review.review_text: Not gonna lie, I did not have high hopes for this laptop. I have an overpowered desktop at home, and I got this for travel/work. Not only can I use it for several high-powered apps, but I can easily remote into my desktop without much lag. I am indifferent about the touch screen, but I haven't truly utilized it yet. Sound quality is okay, but I prefer to use my Bluetooth headphones, which have absolutely no problem connecting. Battery life is typical, I get a couple hours when using my high powered apps, but significantly longer if I'm just using basic functions. Honestly, I highly recommend this laptop.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2025
review.review_text: WATCH OUT EVERYONE!!!Amazon's practice of listing and selling products like Dell computers for third party sellers seems like a scam, since the third party seller can sell old products on Amazon where the warranty is already expired or almost so. And I saw nothing on AMAZON's site when I bought the DELL computer that things like an expired or limited time warranty could be an issue when buying ON AMAZON from a third party seller.Bought this Dell computer on Amazon, February 24, 2025, delivered just a couple days ago and today on March 4, 2025 I checked the WARRANTY which only had less than 6 months LEFT. Dell said the AMAZON third party seller resold the computer on AMAZON months after it bought the computer, and the warranty began to run earlier when the third party seller bought the computer. Not when I purchased the computer on Amazon! This should not be HAPPENING. I contacted the Company and they said nothing was wrong!It came saying the last time it had been updated was August 18th and took the entire first day to get up to date.In regards to the Computer, it runs super fast. It has a battery that dies really quickly which is why I was checking the warranty. The Power in this computer dies so fast and the fans are always running. It the touch screen is nice and it seems to have a good quality. The Sound is pretty good after it is updated. It seems to have more durability than most computers but time will tell.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2025
review.review_text: BUYER BEWARE OF DELL, AMAZON AND THIRD PARTY SELLERS ON AMAZON.  And extended warranty company Asurion.Amazon's  practice of listing and selling products like Dell computers for third party sellers seems like a scam, since the third party seller can sell old products on Amazon where the warranty is already expired or almost so.  And I saw nothing on AMAZON's site when I bought the DELL computer that things like an expired or limited time warranty could be an issue when buying ON AMAZON from a third party seller.Bought this Dell computer on Amazon, July 16, 2024, and Jan.3, 2025 the screen separated from the cover.  Contacted Dell, and they advised the WARRANTY was EXPIRED!  That's less than 6 months.  Dell said the AMAZON third party seller resold the computer on AMAZON months after it bought the computer, and the warranty began to run earlier when the third party seller bought the computer. Not when I purchased the computer on Amazon!Spent hours on the phone with Dell, and they know about this issue with third party sellers.  Even after providing them with the Amazon invoice and receipt of when I took possession of the computer, they would not help me and apply and run the warranty to the date I bought the computer from Amazon.Amazon's rep basically said sorry, but that's my problem for buying from a third party seller. Say what?  I bought the computer on AMAZON and paid AMAZON.  Now I'm out of luck?To make matters worse, I bought an extended warranty on Amazon from Asurion on the same day I bought the Dell computer on Amazon.  When I tried to make a claim, Asurion auto responded that the Dell computer still has the manufactures warranty and to contact Dell, seemingly as a result of only having purchased the computer from Amazon in July.  And not taking into account that the warranty started to run when the third party seller bought the computer months earlier.Shame on Dell, Amazon, and Asurion.

review_summary: The laptop generally performs well for various applications and tasks, offers good value for money, but has inconsistencies in battery life and warranty issues when purchased through third-party sellers on Amazon.

review.review_text: I bought this for my wife to use in doing her job which included a lot of RAM loading for use by two or three types of management software. Love the keyboard which is nice and tight and includes a dedicated number pad to the right side. The core i3 processor is decent and doesn't get overloaded until you really push it which is expected at this price pt.Sometimes it may approach its memory limit but gives decent service - for just 8GB of RAM it works well and the sound quality isn't amazing but adequate. I consider it great value for money. I recommend it but probably with 16GB RAM and at least 500GB of SSD Storage.While in Miami to the end of March this year, we visited 3 retailers of tech products and were amazed at the oversell of sub-standard electronics. When we found this after spending 1/2 day searching at major retailers, we grabbed it! Delivery took under two days and we were impressed with the performance of the laptop and we were able to avoid the over-sell and condescending attitude of poorly trained tech experts who seemed to know much less than me about their own products.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2024
review.review_text: I purchased a Dell 3520 Win 11 Pro from a reseller "Like New". A few things folks might find helpful. 1. Dell sells a limited set of configurations (Memory, SSD, etc), so resellers open the laptop to "upgrade" memory, SSD to offer more choice in configurations. Of course, this begs the question what components are being installed. In my case the components were reasonable: 16GB Samsung DDR4 3200 memory and WD Green 1TB SSD, but its "reasonable" to check the delivered system. 2. Microsoft defaults to keeping a "remarkable" amount of information about your activities, like every app installed, every webpage viewed, etc., so I strongly suggest logging into your Microsoft account (account.microsoft.com) and turn on every privacy control they provide. Then clear the accumulated history and log into the account in a day or so and check if they stopped accumulating data. 3. Windows PRO provides S Mode which is a restrictive version of Windows (only M$ store apps, lighter weight process controls etc). This is mostly for PCs going to less than trusted employees. Turning off S Mode is a one-way trip, i.e. it cannot be reenabled (essentially forever). The system I receive had S Mode off. This is something I would have done anyway, but it's something to consider if you need S Mode for employee users.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
review.review_text: I can only begin this review with serious misgivings about this particular Dell Inspirion laptop.  When one purchases a product from a "Dell Vendor", one presumes it is a 100% Dell product.  Apparently this was not the case with this laptop.  Exactly 3 days after the Amazon/Vendor's return policy ran out, this laptop stopped working.  The error message was "Corrupt Hard Drive".  I can understand electronic devices will sometimes have issues.  I can also understand manufacturers and vendors need to have a limit on how long they will allow items to be returned.  So we called Dell Warranty Service, and they were very helpful.  They sent a box, pre-paid shipping label and we thought that would be the end of it.  Wait a reasonable time for the laptop to be repaired under warranty, and we could go on with our lives.  NOT SO.  According to the Dell Warranty Center, this particular laptop has a 3rd Party Hard Drive.  Not a hard-drive provided by Dell or installed by Dell or used by Dell.  So... our laptop was... in fact... not able to be repaired under warranty.  Dell has offered to fix the laptop and install the correct, but the repair is nearly as much as the laptop cost new from Amazon.  This is totally unacceptable!  When we bought the laptop, we presumed it was a new Dell Laptop with appropriately sourced and installed electronics that would be approved by Dell (or installed by Dell)... BUYER BEWARE of ROKC Electronics.  They have offered NO Help,  NO Sympathy,  and we are now completely out of the money we spent, and have a laptop that is absolutely Useless!!!!  I can only imagine if we were still in the window for return, they would put the same Non-Dell parts back in, and we would be facing similar issues down the road.  This is not the way to run a business.  And certainly not the way an Amazon vendor should be doing business.  Very Very Very Disappointed!

review_summary: The laptop is praised for its quality, ease of use, and performance, but there are significant concerns regarding warranty service and the use of third-party components by some vendors.

review.review_text: Be wary of the license to Office 2021 that is supposed to come with this laptop.It DOES have Outlook, but it is NOT the full blown Outlook, and it only allows one email account to be loaded.It took an hour and a half to determine that.I called Amazon support, and it took them half an hour to tell me i ne3ed to call the seller, which was Dell.Trying to find the right department at Dell took 10 minutes.then it took another half an hour for the technical support department to tell me i would have to call the software support department, and it would be a billable call.So, all told, it took over an hour and a half to determine i had to buy the license for Outlook with full functionality, even though it was supposed to be included.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2025
review.review_text: This review is not regarding the Dell Laptop ... It is for the SELLER - LIGHTENING SALES. We are happy with our Dell Laptop.The purchase was We purchased a Dell Laptop from this vendor. This is what is states in the product description ..."About this item【Lifetime Office】Free Microsoft Office LTSC Profession Plus 2021 with Lifetime License. Including Word, Excel, OneNote, Outlook, PowerPoint, Publisher, Access. Office 2021 is pre-installed and activated, Key is not needed and provided. Please DO NOT install Office 365, which invalidates the Office 2021 license." A day after our order, we received an email stating "there was a problem fulfilling our order. They didn't load Office our our laptop and sent a code from a third party vendor. Via email, I stated I was returning the laptop and expected full refund. In the return instructions, it stated there could be a restocking fee although we never opened the box as well as a fee for shipping both ways. I attempted email confirmation that I would not be charged any fees without response. Reluctantly, we kept the computer and attempted to load the Office Suite via the code they sent. It was cumbersome and we did not want to remove the laptop from safely mode. They should have sent a Microsoft key not a third party vendor. They did refund $39.00 because we had to load it ourselves. This was not was advertised. In the end, we purchased the suite directly from Microsoft. If we knew Office would not have been loaded, we would not have chosen this seller. They didn't respond to emails until I demanded a response, and there is no telephone support. It has been very frustrating, but educational. Always look into who Amazon has fulfilling their orders. Next time, we'll order directly from Dell.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2024
review.review_text: I bought this laptop.  After setting it up by following all of the prompts the computer went to sleep.  When we tried to use it our password would not work.  I called DELL and was on the phone for 6 HOURS trying to get the laptop to run with all of the software it was supposed to have.  After 6 hours I decided to return it.  The company is CHARGING ME 211.06 RESTOCKING FEE for a defective product.  Currently Amazon is reviewing my complaint.1. DON'T BUY FROM GALAXY EXPRESS DEALS2. Read the company ratings for the fine print.  Just because you bought it on Amazon you may be dealing with a shady company with terrible return policies that don't match with Amazon.If I could rate lower than one start I would.I will update this post as things transpire.

review_summary: The laptop generally offers good value and meets basic needs, but buyers have encountered issues with software licenses, connectivity, and support, leading to frustrations with both the product and sellers.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2025

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024
review.review_text: This is a nice little laptop for when you're travelling, which is why I purchased it.  Good price and quick delivery; free support for a while (forgot how long).  No issues when starting it up for the first time, just the regular annoying Windows quirks; seemed that you had to have a Microsoft email account already set up, because I was unable to configure one by following the prompts on the install.  But we all know about MS issues.  No problems getting my critical Windows 10 software installed.  I gave up on getting the MS tools (like Outlook, Excel, Word) re-installed, because of all the license junk they add on to make it impossible (let's just call it "Bill's revenge," ok?  Instead, I used Thunderbird for email (wow!!!!), and Google for the docs.  Way less of a pain.Crisp and clear screen -- really amazing.  Great SSD storage size, and very light.  Haven't tried to use unplugged for an afternoon, but I'm supposing it'll function.  Keyboard is kind of ok; fine for travelling, but not sure about using 24x7.  Blazingly fast, and 32GB of memory is awesome.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2025
review.review_text: Gave the Dell Latitude as a gift. The person that received the computer was and still is happy with it.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2024
review.review_text: I am delighted with this product. The ease and comfort of set up shocked me in its simplicity. The connectivity is so precise that I hardly had to lift a finger in order to load - and instantly use - the programs, software and apps I use regularly. The machine simply went out and transferred the connections that had been in place in my previous machine, once it had securely verified and confirmed my identity and the validity of my access. When I think of the old days of installing this, that and the other...In addition, the speed of operation, the storage capacity and system stability are a dream come true. I only regret having waited as long as I did to upgrade machines.

review.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2025

I hear that the Vostro line has now merged with another Dell line.  Had to get the WIn11 Pro prodct key so our 15 yo grand-daughter(who is very independent) can work with it herself.

review.review_text: This is the worst computer.  Do not order this computer.  Only had the computer for one month.  Have issues  with the screen freezing on three separate occasions.  The last time it happened i was not able to get the machine to work for one week.  The LDC screen needs to be replaced and parts ordered.  Worst purchase i have made on Amazon.  I ordered a Dell 3550 and they sent a Dell 3540.

review_summary: The laptop has received mixed reviews, with many praising its performance, ease of setup, and portability, while others faced issues with defects and functionality, particularly related to the screen freezing.
